text: <@U02F8TTPU>: will ask some folks I know. Direct 'em to you if yes?
sounds great <@U07KCCF0V>, I can put them in touch with Ellen.

<@U02F8TTPU>: my friend is in legal aid so can't help herself but said this: "I am a member of a group on facebook called "Oregon Lawyers of the Left."  If you obtain contact info and a description of what is needed, I could try to post it to the list"
Is there a specific call to action we can put there? I'll pass along.
Also have legal contacts in Michigan if that's also on the table.

<@U02F8TTPU|marissa> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/marissa/F3CJQCN6B/volunteer_lawyers_and_voter_plaintiffs_needed.txt|Volunteer lawyers and voter plaintiffs needed> and commented: <@U07KCCF0V>

file.name: Volunteer_lawyers_and_voter_plaintiffs_needed.txt
file.title: Volunteer lawyers and voter plaintiffs needed
file.preview:
[From my friend Desiree, a lawyer in Seattle]
I've been collaborating with a group of lawyers who are working on bringing lawsuits on behalf of electors and voters regarding the extent to which electors can be bound / punished for voting their conscience. 

I consider this important for two reasons:

I consider this important for two reasons:

text: Sorry it's a little on the long side for social media, but I wouldn't want to make edits to Desiree's words
Perfect. Sent. Thanks! LMK about MI or other states.
<!here|@here> Please give a shout out to your reps over Donald's EPA pick <http://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/07/us/politics/scott-pruitt-epa-trump.html?_r=0>
